abstract: Louisianans arrive in droves at 75th International Rice Festival to cheer Edwin Edwards, former governor and ex-convict who embodies populist tradition of Huey Long.
snippet: People in Louisiana still come out to cheer for Edwin Edwards, the dryly humorous, unapologetically corrupt former governor, but they are electing a different sort of politician.
lead_paragraph: People in Louisiana still come out to cheer for Edwin Edwards, the dryly humorous, unapologetically corrupt former governor, but they are electing a different sort of politician.

headline.main: Well-Known Felon Still Draws a Crowd, but Louisiana Has Moved On
headline.print_headline: Well-Known Felon Still Draws a Crowd, but Louisiana Has Moved On
headline.seo: Edwin Edwards Is Still Famous, but Louisiana Politics Has Moved On
